sense.name: solemnly promise, bind by oath
sense.commentary: Includes: SWEAR IN Syntax is: NP1[agent] SWEAR VP[non-finite] NP1[human] SWEAR (NP2[human] to) NP3 Note: participants can include an individual making a promise, an individual being bound to a promise, and witnesses (animate or inanimate)
sense.examples: He swore to uphold the law. He swore an oath to be the kingdom's champion. We were sworn to secrecy. He was so bad at lying, I swore him to silence on a deep-cover. He swore on a historic bible and had no objections to doing it. He swore by his crown of moonshine that he would battle all the stars in the skies. The speaker of the House swore in the new President.

sense.name: utter profanities
sense.examples: I got so used to using bad language that I almost swore at my students. He claimed that the referee swore at him. No matter what your mother said, there may be times when swearing is appropriate.

sense.name: assert sincerely, avow, state as true
sense.examples: I solemnly swear that I am up to no good. I swear to you Miss Scarlett, I don't know nothing about cooking collards. He swore the results had to be wrong and that I'd made an error somewhere.

sense.name: have confidence or faith in
sense.commentary: Syntax is: NP1 SWEAR BY NP2[object] Note: compare carefully to sense 1; in this sense NP2 is the object of confidence, not the "witness" to an oath
sense.examples: I swear by my grandmother's recipes. He swore by Craftsman tools.

sense.name: abstain from
sense.examples: I have sworn off cigarettes altogether. He swore off dangerous stunts like wing-walking on biplanes.

sense.name: deliver a warrant or summons to someone
sense.examples: He swore out a warrant on March 1 for the arrest of Queensbury. He swore out the affidavit on condition Angelico send them to the ARRB.
